meanings.definition: Beyond the range of normal human senses.
meanings.sent1: The supersensory experience left her in awe of the unseen world around her.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the supersensory phenomena that could not be detected by the five basic senses.
meanings.sent3: The cat's supersensory ability to detect approaching earthquakes made it the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition was so supersensory, it was as if she had a sixth sense guiding her.
meanings.sent5: The artist's supersensory perception allowed him to see colors beyond the visible spectrum.

meanings.definition: Relating to or involving extrasensory perception.
meanings.sent1: The twins shared a supersensory connection that allowed them to know each other's thoughts.
meanings.sent2: The psychic claimed to have supersensory abilities that enabled her to see into the future.
meanings.sent3: The magician's supersensory trick amazed the audience as he predicted their chosen cards.
meanings.sent4: Her supersensory dreams often foretold events that later came true.
meanings.sent5: The child's supersensory perception of ghosts in the old house sent shivers down his spine.
